Located in [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]], [[Florida]], '''Florida Hospital''' treats over 32,000 inpatients and 53,600 outpatients annually. This 900+ bed, acute-care community hospital also serves as a major tertiary facility for much of the Southeast. It is a part of the Florida Hospital system, a group of private hospitals which is owned and operated by [[Adventist Health System]], a part of the worldwide organization of the [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]]. It is home to nationally recognized institutes for cancer, cardiology, diabetes, orthopedics and neuroscience.{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} This hospital is not a level one trauma center but it does accept transfers for specialty care. The main purpose of the Florida Hospital group is medical emergencies and in-patient care.
'''Locations''':
Florida Hospital has seven campuses owned and operated by Adventist Health System: * Florida Hospital Orlando (Main Campus) * Florida Hospital Altamonte * Florida Hospital Apopka * Florida Hospital Celebration Health * Florida Hospital East Orlando * Florida Hospital Kissimmee * Winter Park Memorial Hospital
'''Florida Hospital Employment'''
Florida Hospital manages most of its recruiting and hiring internally, constantly filling nursing and technologist positions for its network of hospitals. Qualified applicants are able to apply for nursing, therapy and technologist jobs directly on the [http://www.nursingjobsinflorida.com Florida Hospital Nursing] website.
